result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Michelle L. Quechol Pierce

records.addlTxt: Court finds probable cause, binds defendant over for further proceedings

2:28 PM Defendant Michelle L. Quechol Pierce in court, in custody.  Attorney Allison J Borsheim in court for Michelle L. Quechol Pierce.  Attorney Peggy A. Crooks-Mishacoff in court for State of Wisconsin. State called witness, Detective Peter Warning of Portage Police Department, sworn. He appeared by Zoom. Direct exam. Witness identified the defendant. Direct exam cont'd. Cross exam. Redirect. States closing argument. Attorney Borsheim objected to bind over. Court found probable cause that a felony was committed. Court will take this under advisement and issue a written ruling in 30 days. 2:50 PM
Order on Request to Appear Remotely - granted

Atty Crooks-Mishacoff's request to have her witness appear remotely filed on 9-7-22is approved to appear by phone/zoom. Atty. Crooks-Mishacoff for How to appear remotely has been provided with the telephone number/zoom instruction to appear. 
Instructions for How to Appear Remotely

to Appear Remotely for the 9/14/22 Prelim filed by Atty Crooks-Mishacoff

APPROVED.

9:11 AM Cases called: 22CF122, 22CF385, 22CF390. Defendant Michelle L. Quechol (Pierce) in court, in custody.  Attorney Allison J Borsheim in court for Michelle L. Quechol (Pierce).  Prosecuting attorney Peggy A. Crooks-Mishacoff in court for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Borsheim requested a preliminary hearing in all cases. 9:12 AM
Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 14, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
